detaileddescription.para: Size of one logical sector in bytes.
Maximum length of file/directory name (excluding terminator).
Number of free-space bits stored in a sector.
Preferred chunk size (in sectors) for reading the free space map.

briefdescription.para: Default number of sectors allocated for a directory block.

detaileddescription.para: The first entry is a directory start entry containing metadata and a continuation pointer; remaining entries store files. At 64 sectors, a directory can contain up to 127 files.
Entry is a directory.
Entry is locked/read-only.
Entry is a directory start block.

briefdescription.para: Filesystem identifier magic ("RetroFS1").

detaileddescription.para: Stored in the description block for on-disk format verification.

briefdescription.para: RetroFS GPT Partition Type GUID.

detaileddescription.para: This UUID v4 is reserved for Retro Rocket's RetroFS partitions.
Sectors per L1 group (2 MiB at 512B).
L1 groups per L2 super-group.

briefdescription.para: Align a value upwards to the next multiple of a.

detaileddescription.para: Filesystem magic (RFS_ID).
Sector address of root directory start entry.
Sector address of free space map start.
Length of free space map in sectors.
Checksum of the free space map.
Incremented whenever the FS is modified.
Incremented when file changes.
Filesystem creation time (UTC).
Structured view.
Raw bytes view.
Free/used sector flags.
Entry flags (RFS_FLAG_*).
Entry flags (must include RFS_FLAG_DIR_START).
Null-terminated filename.
First sector of file data.
File length in bytes.
Allocated length in sectors
Creation timestamp (UTC).
Last modification timestamp (UTC).
Reserved for future use / alignment.
Human-readable directory title.
Sector of parent directory start entry.
Number of sectors in this directory block.
Sector of next directory block, or 0 if none.
Directory start entry.
File entry.

briefdescription.para: On-disk description block containing global filesystem metadata.

detaileddescription.para: Unified representation of either a directory start or file entry.
On-disk directory start entry.
On-disk file entry structure for non-directory entries.
One sector of the free space map, containing an array of 64-bit bitfields.
Padded variant of the description block to exactly fill one sector.
Occupies exactly one sector. This is the first structure read when mounting a RetroFS volume.
This is always the first entry in a directory block.
Each directory block sector contains two of these (half-sector entries).
On-disk description block containing global filesystem metadata.
A disk partition entry within the MBR.
Structure and bitfields for representing IP fragmentation. Used within an ip_packet_t.
FAT32 FSINFO structure.
There is actually more to an ethernet frame than this (see the STD documents!) but we don't have access to it from the software.
Definition of a DHCP packet.
Format of an ARP packet (per RFC 826)
Root System Description Table (RSDT)
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: Get the default reservation size for a file based on extension.

simplesect.para: Size in bytes to reserve. Defaults to 128 KB if not in table.

briefdescription.para: Set or clear a bit in a bitset.
Get the value of a bit from a bitset.

simplesect.para: True if bit is set, false if clear.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the number of bytes needed to store a bitset of given size.

simplesect.para: Number of bytes required.

briefdescription.para: Initialise the RetroFS subsystem.

detaileddescription.para: Prepares any global state needed for RetroFS operation. This should be called once during kernel initialisation before mounting any RetroFS volumes.

briefdescription.para: Format a block device or partition with a fresh RetroFS filesystem.

detaileddescription.para: Writes a new description block, initialises the free space map, and creates an empty root directory.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an rfs_t structure describing the target volume.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error (e.g., device write failure).

briefdescription.para: Read raw sectors from the underlying device.

detaileddescription.para: Low-level helper for retrieving a contiguous range of sectors from the block device.

parameterdescription.para: Number of bytes to read (must be a multiple of sector size).

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (rfs_t *rfs, uint64_t start_sectors, uint64_t size_bytes, const void *buffer)
memberdef.name: rfs_write_device

briefdescription.para: Write raw sectors to the underlying device.

detaileddescription.para: Low-level helper for storing a contiguous range of sectors to the block device.

parameterdescription.para: Number of bytes to write (must be a multiple of sector size).

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error.

briefdescription.para: Find a contiguous extent of free sectors.

detaileddescription.para: Searches the in-memory free space map for an extent of at least the requested length.

parameterdescription.para: Output: first sector of found extent.

simplesect.para: true if an extent was found, false if insufficient free space.

memberdef.argsstring: (rfs_t *info, uint64_t start_sector, uint64_t length_sectors, bool mark_used)
memberdef.name: rfs_mark_extent

briefdescription.para: Mark a contiguous extent as used or free in the free space map.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the in-memory free space tracking structures; caller must ensure changes are persisted to disk if necessary.

parameterdescription.para: true to mark as used, false to mark as free.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error (e.g., bounds check fail).

briefdescription.para: Build L1/L2 cache structures from the on-disk free space map.

detaileddescription.para: Reads the free space map from disk and generates the in-memory summary structures used for fast allocation.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a directory structure from a VFS handle.

detaileddescription.para: Used by the VFS layer to resolve a directory handle into a RetroFS directory block for further operations.

simplesect.para: Pointer to RetroFS directory block, or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Remove a file from a directory.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes the directory entry and frees the associated file data sectors in the free space map.

simplesect.para: true on success, false if not found or error occurred.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *f, uint64_t start, uint32_t length, unsigned char *buffer)
memberdef.name: rfs_read_file

briefdescription.para: Read part or all of a file.

detaileddescription.para: Reads data starting at the given offset (in bytes from start of file).

parameterdescription.para: Offset into file to begin reading.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error or bounds violation.

briefdescription.para: Create a new file in a directory.

detaileddescription.para: Allocates space, writes a directory entry, and sets initial file size.

simplesect.para: Sector number of new files start, or 0 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Create a new directory within an existing directory.

detaileddescription.para: Allocates space for the directory start block and updates the parent.

simplesect.para: Sector number of new directorys start block, or 0 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Remove an empty directory from its parent.

simplesect.para: true on success, false if directory is not empty or not found.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *f, uint64_t start, uint32_t length, unsigned char *buffer)
memberdef.name: rfs_write_file

briefdescription.para: Write part or all of a file.

detaileddescription.para: Writes data starting at the given offset (in bytes from start of file). Caller must ensure enough space has been allocated beforehand.

parameterdescription.para: Offset into file to begin writing.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error or bounds violation.

briefdescription.para: Truncate or extend a file to a given length.

detaileddescription.para: If truncating, deallocates excess sectors. If extending, allocates new sectors (contents unspecified).

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error or insufficient space.

briefdescription.para: Insert or update a directory entry on disk.

detaileddescription.para: If an entry with the same name (case-insensitive) already exists in the directory chain, its metadata is updated in-place, preserving the case of the supplied file->filename. If no matching entry exists, a new one is appended in the first available slot; if the directory is full, a new continuation block is allocated and linked.
This function does not allocate or free file payload sectors if the file size changes; it is limited to updating directory metadata and allocating directory blocks when necessary.

simplesect.para: file must be non-NULL.
file->directory must point to a valid fs_tree_t representing the parent directory.
file->filename must point to a non-empty NUL-terminated string.
On success, the directory chain on disk contains the inserted or updated entry, and file reflects the same metadata supplied.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a VFS directory entry to insert or update.
Reserved extent for the file in sectors

simplesect.para: The same file pointer on success, or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Remove a directory entry from disk by name.

detaileddescription.para: Finds the first entry in the directory chain whose name matches file->filename case-insensitively, removes it, and compacts the remaining entries in that block to avoid internal holes. Continuation blocks are not freed, even if they become empty.
This function does not modify the free-space map for the file payload; only the directory metadata is altered.

simplesect.para: file must be non-NULL.
file->directory must point to a valid fs_tree_t representing the parent directory.
file->filename must point to a non-empty NUL-terminated string.
On success, the directory chain on disk no longer contains an entry matching file->filename in a case-insensitive comparison.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a VFS directory entry identifying the file to remove.

simplesect.para: true on success, false if the entry was not found or on I/O error.

briefdescription.para: Convert a size in bytes to the number of sectors required.

detaileddescription.para: This rounds up to the nearest whole sector, so that any non-zero remainder results in an additional sector being counted.

simplesect.para: Number of sectors required to store bytes.

memberdef.argsstring: (rfs_t *info, fs_tree_t *tree, const char *name, uint64_t *out_sector, size_t *out_index, rfs_directory_entry_inner_t *out_entry_copy)
memberdef.name: rfs_locate_entry

briefdescription.para: Locate a directory entry by name within a given directory.

detaileddescription.para: Searches the specified directory (including any continuation blocks) for an entry whose filename matches name. If found, returns its on-disk location and a copy of the directory entry structure.

parameterdescription.para: VFS tree node representing the directory to search.
Receives the sector number containing the entry.
Receives the index of the entry within that sector.
Receives a copy of the on-disk entry.

simplesect.para: true if the entry was found, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the exact number of bytes currently in use on the volume.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the in-memory Level-1 freesector counters built by rfs_build_level_caches() to determine usage precisely. It sums the free sector counts for all L1 groups, converts the total to bytes, and subtracts from the total volume size. The result is exact as long as the L1 cache is up to date.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the RetroFS volume context (must have valid L1 cache).

simplesect.para: Number of bytes currently allocated/used on the volume.
If the volume was not cleanly unmounted, ensure the L1 cache has been rebuilt from the on-disk free space map before calling this function.

briefdescription.para: VFS endpoint to get free space on the filesystem in bytes.

simplesect.para: free space in bytes

memberdef.argsstring: (sizeof(rfs_directory_entry_t)==(512/2), "Directory entry must be exactly half a sector")
memberdef.name: _Static_assert

param.type: "Directory entry must be exactly half a sector"

memberdef.argsstring: (sizeof(rfs_description_block_padded_t)==512, "Description block must be exactly one sector")
memberdef.name: _Static_assert

param.type: "Description block must be exactly one sector"

briefdescription.para: Core structures, constants, and API definitions for RetroFS an ADFS 'L' formatinspired filesystem for Retro Rocket.

detaileddescription.para:
Craig Edwards (craigedwards@brainbox.cc)
RetroFS is a sector-based filesystem inspired by the Acorn ADFS 'L' format. It is optimised for simplicity of implementation and fast free-space allocation, achieved by caching the entire multi-level free space map in RAM. This approach trades higher memory usage (~200 MB/TB) for minimal device I/O during allocation and deletion, making it well-suited to systems where RAM is plentiful relative to storage speed.

The on-disk format is compact and self-contained, with a fixed-size description block, hierarchical free space map, and half-sector directory entries. The in-memory layout is designed for fast lookups and minimal pointer chasing.

simplesect.para: (c) 20122025 Craig Edwards
